title: Why do we wrinkle when wet?

multiple-choice.question: What happens to human fingers and toes when immersed in water for longer than 10 minutes?

options.label: C
options.text: They emerge looking like raisins, all wrinkled

multiple-choice.question: What was the initial theory behind the wrinkling of skin when exposed to water for a prolonged period?

options.label: A
options.text: An active response of the nervous system

options.label: B
options.text: A type of osmosis caused by water passing into the dry outer layer of skin

options.label: C
options.text: A result of the skin's natural shedding process

options.label: D
options.text: A side effect of water pressure

multiple-choice.question: What observation led researchers to reconsider the initial theory behind wrinkled skin?

options.label: A
options.text: Patients with nerve damage had smoother skin

options.label: B
options.text: Patients with skin conditions had wrinkled skin

options.label: C
options.text: The wrinkling effect occurred only in cold water

options.label: D
options.text: The wrinkling effect occurred only in warm water

multiple-choice.question: What is the actual cause of wrinkled digits when exposed to water for a prolonged period?

options.label: A
options.text: The passive flow of water through the skin

options.label: B
options.text: An active response of the nervous system to prolonged moisture

options.label: C
options.text: A result of the skin's natural shedding process

options.label: D
options.text: A side effect of water pressure

multiple-choice.question: How does the nervous system cause wrinkling of the skin?

options.label: A
options.text: By expanding blood vessels below the skin

options.label: B
options.text: By constricting blood vessels below the skin

options.label: C
options.text: By increasing the skin's surface area

options.label: D
options.text: By decreasing the skin's surface area

multiple-choice.question: What is one possible evolutionary function of wrinkled skin?

options.label: A
options.text: To protect the skin from the sun

options.label: B
options.text: To give our ancestors a better grip while working in wet conditions

options.label: D
options.text: To aid in the healing process

multiple-choice.question: According to a 2013 study, what advantage did subjects with wrinkly digits have over those with non-wrinkly fingers?

options.label: A
options.text: They picked up dry objects faster

options.label: B
options.text: They picked up wet objects 12 percent faster

options.label: C
options.text: They had better footing on dry surfaces

options.label: D
options.text: They had better grip on smooth surfaces

multiple-choice.question: How do wrinkles on the skin help with grip, according to the study?

options.label: A
options.text: By increasing the skin's surface area

options.label: B
options.text: By channeling the water away, like the treads on car tires

multiple-choice.question: Why might it be disadvantageous to have wrinkly skin all the time?

options.label: A
options.text: It would make the skin more sensitive

options.label: B
options.text: It would make the skin less sensitive

options.label: C
options.text: It would increase the risk of skin cancer

options.label: D
options.text: It would decrease the skin's natural shedding process
